channel.title: How do I package a client?
channel.description:
How do I package a client basically? Example. I want a file with all the .class files and another file with the .java files and then the run batch file outside the files.
Example: Class Files Java Files Batch File

item.title: How do I package a client?
item.dc:creator: @Crn Crn_
item.description:
@Crn wrote:

Thanks!

Read full topic
item.source: How do I package a client?

item.title: How do I package a client?
item.dc:creator: @Scarecrows Scarecrows
item.description:
@Scarecrows wrote:

Here is an example for building / compiling class & java files:

@echo off cd Java "C:/program files/java/jdk1.6.0_10/bin/javac" -d ../Class *.java pause

Here is an example for then initializing your client:

@echo off cd Class java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./mysql.jar server pause

Edit: Make sure you create the folders ‘Java’ and ‘Class’ first, the batch files should be outside of those folders, but you could easily modify the batch code to be able to use it inside of a folder…

Read full topic
item.source: How do I package a client?

item.title: How do I package a client?
item.dc:creator: @Scarecrows Scarecrows
item.description:
@Scarecrows wrote:

Not really packaging… but just make your compiler or w.e output the class file into the folder you want and just change the directory inside your batch file that initializes the client. With what you want to do, all you have to do is change the directories in your batch files.

Read full topic
